items.title: Minimal, Super-Functional Bags for Creatives — Designed by an Architect
items.abstract: The Atelier YUL’s sleek carryalls were born out of one woman’s frustration at the lack of options for transporting large-format drawings and models.

items.title: By Design | An L.A. Gallery and Shop So Laid Back, It’s at the Curator’s House
items.abstract: Julia Leonard’s Either Way L.A. project showcases functional art objects by emerging talent in a space below her Echo Park home.

items.title: Officials are seeking to instill confidence in New York City’s subway system.
items.abstract: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Wednesday that the goal is to “restore ridership and the functionality of New York.”

items.title: Bookshelf | A Surrealist Ode to a Radical Era in Furniture Design
items.abstract: The artist and provocateur Maurizio Cattelan and his frequent co-conspirator, the photographer Pierpaolo Ferrari, release a book capturing avant-garde furniture from the late ’60s in often-outrageous tableaux.

items.title: Does Digital Age Overcomplicate Design?
items.abstract: Too many products use complexity to mask their flaws.
